results.t: what does canon mean when referencing a show or movie?
results.p: 'Canon' means that the material was produced by the official source for the show/movie. It's derived from 'Canon law' - which was official Catholic theology.

results.t: What does Canon mean when referencing a show or ...
results.p: Canonical means a thing that really happened within the fictional reality of the show. Non-canonical means a thing that didn't happen within ...
The canon of a work of fiction is the body of works taking place in a particular fictional world that are widely considered to be official or authoritative.

results.t: Just what does the word "canon" mean when referring to ...
results.p: Apr 24, 2021 — In layman's terms, "canon" refers to the original storyline regardless of the author/producer/etc. For example, the Halloween series of movies.

results.t: Canon (fiction) | Ultimate Pop Culture Wiki - Fandom
results.p: In fiction, canon is the material accepted as officially part of the story in an individual universe of that story by its fan base.
